data.title: Biography of Peter Capet Count Alençon 1251-1284
data.meta_description: Biography of Peter Capet Count Alençon 1251-1284 including his birth, marriages, death and life events, life events of his siblings, and his ancestry to five generations, royal ancestors and royal descendants.
data.text:
On 08 Nov 1226 [his grandfather] King Louis VIII of France (age 39) died. His son [his father] King Louis IX of France (age 12) succeeded IX King France: Capet.

On 27 May 1234 [his father] King Louis IX of France (age 20) and [his mother] Margaret Provence Queen Consort France 1221-1295 (age 13) were married. She by marriage Queen Consort of France. She the daughter of Raymond Berenguer Provence IV Count Provence 1198-1245 (age 36) and Beatrice Savoy Countess Provence 1198-1267 (age 36). He the son of King Louis VIII of France and Blanche Ivrea Queen Consort France (age 46). They were half third cousins. He a great grandson of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England.

In 1251 Peter Capet Count Alençon was born to King Louis IX of France (age 36) and Margaret Provence Queen Consort France 1221-1295 (age 30) at Holy Land. He a great x 2 grandson of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England.

In 1269 Peter Capet Count Alençon (age 18) was created Count Alençon.

In 1272 Peter Capet Count Alençon (age 21) and Joan Chatillon I Countess Blois 1253-1291 (age 19) were married. She the daughter of John Chatillon I Count Saint Pol -1280 and Alix Capet Countess Saint Pol 1243-1288 (age 29). He the son of King Louis IX of France and Margaret Provence Queen Consort France 1221-1295 (age 51). They were fourth cousins. He a great x 2 grandson of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England. She a great x 5 granddaughter of King William "Conqueror" I of England.

In 1276 [his son] Louis Capet was born to Peter Capet Count Alençon (age 25) and [his wife] Joan Chatillon I Countess Blois 1253-1291 (age 23). He a great x 3 grandson of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England.

In 1277 [his son] Louis Capet (age 1) died.

In 1278 [his son] Philip Capet was born to Peter Capet Count Alençon (age 27) and [his wife] Joan Chatillon I Countess Blois 1253-1291 (age 25). He a great x 3 grandson of King Henry "Curtmantle" II of England.

In 1279 [his son] Philip Capet (age 1) died.

On 06 Apr 1284 Peter Capet Count Alençon (age 33) was killed at Salerno by Aragonese mercenaries. He had no issue; Count Alençon extinct.

On 29 Jan 1291 [his former wife] Joan Chatillon I Countess Blois 1253-1291 (age 38) died.
